intro: Trichodesma zeylanicum var. sericeum, commonly known as silver trichodesma, is a flowering plant native to southern Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscape design.
